section: Client acknowledges and agrees that any due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are not subject to any delay.
explanation: This statement creates a contradiction because it is almost impossible to guarantee that any due dates will never be delayed. Delays can be caused by many reasons, and it is unreasonable to assert that there will be no delays, therefore, the document becomes internally inconsistent.

section: Client agrees to pay that to Company a reasonable sum (the "Contract Price") to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in general accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A.
explanation: While the contract mentions the Contract Price, Section 2 specifies the price to be $5,000, but there is no mention of this price being the 'Contract Price'. The contract Price is not clearly defined, which is an example of misalignment.

section: Company is not obligated to provide any Customer Service except as specified in this Section. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
explanation: This creates ambiguity as to the nature and extent of the Customer Service that will be provided. The first sentence suggests that Customer Service will be provided, as specified in this section, yet the very next sentence contradicts that by stating that the Company can alter or cease providing Customer Service. The statement gives too much discretion to the Company and allows them to not have to provide customer service, even though it may be a required obligation.
